intro: Hyptis argentea, commonly known as silver hyptis, is a flowering plant native to the Americas. It belongs to the Lamiaceae family, which includes many aromatic herbs and shrubs. The plant is characterized by its silvery-gray foliage, which gives it its common name. It produces small, tubular flowers that are typically blue or purple in color. Hyptis argentea is often used in traditional medicine and as a ornamental plant due to its attractive appearance and aromatic properties.
